questions.question: What happens to the output of an amplifier when it reaches saturation?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Beyond a certain input level, the output no longer increases linearly.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The output doesn't go to zero unless the circuit fails.
explanations.c: Correct! The amplifier clips the signal due to voltage limitations. Read more
explanations.d: Incorrect. Oscillations occur due to instability, not saturation.

questions.question: Which parameter directly affects the gain in a non-inverting operational amplifier?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Capacitance affects frequency response, not gain directly.
explanations.b: Partially correct, but gain is primarily set by resistor values.
explanations.c: Correct! Gain = 1 + (Rf / Rin) in non-inverting configuration. Reference
explanations.d: Incorrect. Frequency affects bandwidth, not gain directly.

questions.question: What does a Bode plot generated in Simulink show for an amplifier circuit?

answers.b: Time delay between input and output

explanations.a: Incorrect. Bode plots are frequency-domain tools.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Time delay is not directly shown.
explanations.c: Correct! Bode plots illustrate how gain and phase change with frequency. More here
explanations.d: Incorrect. Thermal performance isn't shown in Bode plots.

questions.question: Which Simulink block is commonly used to define time-varying input signals?

explanations.b: Incorrect. Gain scales input, not generates it.
explanations.c: Correct! The Sine Wave block is used to input varying signals. View Docs
explanations.d: Incorrect. Mux combines signals, not generates them.

questions.question: In a linear amplifier simulation, increasing input frequency beyond bandwidth results in:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Gain decreases as frequency exceeds bandwidth.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Linearity may not improve at high frequencies.
explanations.c: Correct! The amplifier can't handle frequencies beyond its bandwidth, so the output attenuates. See explanation
explanations.d: Incorrect. Output typically changes with frequency.
